active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a world of increasing data breaches, should companies prioritize longer retention periods for forensic analysis or shorter ones for privacy? Argue both sides using NIST SP 800-53 and ICO guidelines, citing specific controls or principles.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Data Retention Policies (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Information Systems Security Capabilities > Data Protection and Privacy > Data Lifecycle Management > Data Retention Policies). Voter consensus: 82.9% approval (7 voters) emphasizes completeness (full ICO/NIST/GDPR/HIPAA details, retention schedules, disposition), pedagogy (Bloom's objectives), scaffolding (4 layers), active learning, and connections (eDiscovery, AI optimization). **Completed Research Context:** Data retention policies manage data storage per laws (e.g., NIST SP 800-53 SI-12: retain per requirements, full lifecycle). ICO: 'Retain only as needed; schedules by type (e.g., HR: 6 years post-employment); disposition: secure delete.' GDPR Art.5(1)(e): Minimize storage. HIPAA: 6 years PHI. Best practices: Classify data, schedules (logs:90 days, financial:7yrs), methods (overwriting, shredding), automate via DLP. Sources: NIST.gov SP800-53r5, ico.org.uk/for-organisations/guide-to-data-protection/guide-to-the-general-data-protection-regulation-gdpr/storage-limitation/, hhs.gov/hipaa/for-professionals/privacy/guidance/retention/index.html, gdpr.eu/article-5-personal-data-processing-principles/. Use these EXACT learning objectives [insert array above], active learning activities [insert above], and 4 scaffolding layers [insert above] to ensure flashcards build progressively. Generate flashcards per this schema [insert schema above]. Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards, each as: {"type": "mcq/definition/scenario", "front": "...", "back": {"answer": "...", "explanation": "...", "bloom_level": "...", "layer": 1-4, "source": "..."}}. Cover all layers/Bloom's levels proportionally. Make explanations educational, tying to objectives/activities (e.g., 'Relates to problem-solving exercise').
